content.1: The same day went Jesus out of the house, and sat by the sea side.
content.2: And great multitudes were gathered together unto him, so that he went into a ship, and sat; and the whole multitude stood on the shore.
content.3: And he spake many things unto them in parables, saying,
content.5: Some fell upon stony places, where they had not much earth: and forthwith they sprung up, because they had no deepness of earth:
content.6: And when the sun was up, they were scorched; and because they had no root, they withered away.
content.7: And some fell among thorns; and the thorns sprung up, and choked them:
content.8: But other fell into good ground, and brought forth fruit, some an hundredfold, some sixtyfold, some thirtyfold.
content.9: Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.
content.10: And the disciples came, and said unto him, Why speakest thou unto them in parables?
content.11: He answered and said unto them,
content.12: For whosoever hath, to him shall be given, and he shall have more abundance: but whosoever hath not, from him shall be taken away even that he hath.
content.13: Therefore speak I to them in parables: because they seeing see not; and hearing they hear not, neither do they understand.
content.14: And in them is fulfilled the prophecy of Esaias, which saith, By hearing ye shall hear, and shall not understand; and seeing ye shall see, and shall not perceive:
content.15: For this people’s heart is waxed gross, and
content.17: For verily I say unto you, That many prophets and righteous
content.19: When any one heareth the word of the kingdom, and understandeth
content.20: But he that received the seed into stony places, the same is he that heareth the word, and anon with joy receiveth it;
content.21: Yet hath he not root in himself, but dureth for a while: for when tribulation or persecution ariseth because of the word, by and by he is offended.
content.22: He also that received seed among the thorns is he that heareth the word; and the care of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, choke the word, and he becometh unfruitful.
content.23: But he that received seed into the good ground is he that heareth the word, and understandeth
content.24: Another parable put he forth unto them, saying,
content.25: But while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way.
content.26: But when the blade was sprung up, and brought forth fruit, then appeared the tares also.
content.27: So the servants of the householder came and said unto him, Sir, didst not thou sow good seed in thy field? from whence then hath it tares?
content.28: He said unto them, An enemy hath done this. The servants said unto him, Wilt thou then that we go and gather them up?
content.29: But he said, Nay; lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them.
content.30: Let both grow together until the harvest: and in the time of harvest I will say to the reapers, Gather ye together first the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them: but gather the wheat into my barn.
content.31: Another parable put he forth unto them, saying,
content.32: Which indeed is the least of all seeds: but when it is grown, it is the greatest among herbs, and becometh a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in the branches thereof.
content.33: Another parable spake he unto them;
content.34: All these things spake Jesus unto the multitude in parables; and without a parable spake he not unto them:
content.35: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet, saying, I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things which have been kept secret from the foundation of the world.
content.36: Then Jesus sent the multitude away, and went into the house: and his disciples came unto him, saying, Declare unto us the parable of the tares of the field.
content.37: He answered and said unto them,
content.38: The field is the world; the good seed are the children of the kingdom; but the tares are the children of the wicked
content.39: The enemy that sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the world; and the reapers are the angels.
content.40: As therefore the tares are gathered and burned in the fire; so shall it be in the end of this world.
content.41: The Son of man shall send forth his angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all things that offend, and them which do iniquity;
content.42: And shall cast them into a furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.
content.43: Then shall the righteous shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.
content.44: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto treasure hid in a field; the which when a man hath found, he hideth, and for joy thereof goeth and selleth all that he hath, and buyeth that field.
content.45: Again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man, seeking goodly pearls:
content.46: Who, when he had found one pearl of great price, went and sold all that he had, and bought it.
content.48: Which, when it was full, they drew to shore, and sat down, and gathered the good into vessels, but cast the bad away.
content.49: So shall it be at the end of the world: the angels shall come forth, and sever the wicked from among the just,
content.50: And shall cast them into the furnace of fire: there shall be wailing and gnashing of teeth.

content.58: And he did not many mighty works there because of their unbelief.
